citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female Yorkshire Terrier ID #83 was seen with a head tilt, and occasional head shake. Upon closer observation noticed
the entire left ear flap was about 3/4 inch thick and felt like the ear flap was full of fluid. This abnormal appearing area
could be the result of injury, infection or a variety of veterinary medical conditions which may be painful. The licensee
must consult a veterinarian in order to ensure that accurate diagnoses are obtained and appropriate treatment plans are
developed and followed. The licensee must ensure that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times.
To be corrected by 24 Apr 2023.

In approximately 10 enclosures housing approximately 24 dogs, there was an excess build up of feces inside the outdoor
portion of the enclosures. The facility representative stated he cleaned the outside portion of the enclosures about 2 days
prior to the inspection. A build up of feces is a disease hazard and can attract pest. The licensee must ensure all surfaces
which come in contact with the dogs and puppies are spot cleaned daily.
To be corrected by 24 Apr 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female Yorkshire Terrier ID #83 was seen with a head tilt, and occasional head shake.  Upon closer observation noticed 
the entire left ear flap was about 3/4 inch thick and felt like the ear flap was full of fluid. This abnormal appearing area 
could be the result of injury, infection or a variety of veterinary medical conditions which may be painful. The licensee 
must consult  a veterinarian in order to ensure that accurate diagnoses are obtained and appropriate treatment plans are 
developed and followed. The licensee must ensure that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times. 
To be corrected by 24 Apr 2023. 
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
In approximately 10 enclosures housing approximately 24 dogs, there was an excess build up of feces inside the outdoor 
portion of the enclosures. The facility representative stated he cleaned the outside portion of the enclosures about 2 days 
prior to the inspection. A build up of feces is a disease hazard and can attract pest. The licensee must ensure all surfaces 
which come in contact with the dogs and puppies are spot cleaned daily. 
To be corrected by 24 Apr 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

n
